Package de.hshannover.dqgui.framework

Class ApplicationContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.hshannover.dqgui.framework.ApplicationContext
  • public final class ApplicationContext
extends java.lang.Object
    ApplicationContext acts as a window management framework.

    It will create and keep track of Manageable and enforce the WindowInstances.
    If a view already exists and should only exist once it will be pushed into the foreground.
    If multiple views of the same type are limited by an amount > 1 it will throw an IllegalArgumentException once that amount is reached.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ApplicationContext()
      Create a new ApplicationContext without dependency injection.
      ApplicationContext​(java.lang.String config)
      Create a new ApplicationContext with dependency injection.

    • Method Detail

      • loadInitial

        public void loadInitial​(Manageable main,
                        java.lang.String title,
                        java.util.function.Consumer<javafx.stage.Stage> configuration)
        Create the initial stage that returns a stage object.
        This method can only be called once.
        Parameters:
        main - that shall be created as the initial stage
        title - to set as title for the initial stage
        configuration - configure and show stage here
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if shutdown
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if view is managed by identifier

      • loadInitial

        public void loadInitial​(Manageable main,
                        java.lang.String title,
                        java.util.function.Consumer<javafx.stage.Stage> configuration,
                        java.lang.Object... args)
        Create the initial stage that returns a stage object.
        This method can only be called once.
        Parameters:
        main - that shall be created as the initial stage
        title - to set as title for the initial stage
        configuration - configure and show stage here
        args - arguments for the constructor/callback method of the view (no generics supported)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if shutdown
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if view is managed by identifier
